text: The women's single sculls competition at the 2019 World Rowing Championships took place at the Linz-Ottensheim regatta venue. A top-nine finish ensured qualification for the Tokyo Olympics. ==Schedule== The schedule was as follows: {| class="wikitable" ! Date ! Time ! Round |- | Sunday 25 August 2019 || 16:17 || Heats |- | Monday 26 August 2019 || 15:12 || Repechages |- | rowspan=2|Wednesday 28 August 2019 || 12:53 || Quarterfinals |- | 16:28 || Semifinals E/F/G |- | rowspan=4|Thursday 29 August 2019 || 16:20 || Semifinals C/D |- | 17:00 || Final G |- | 17:15 || Final F |- | 17:40 || Final E |- | Friday 30 August 2019 || 12:40 || Semifinals A/B |- | rowspan=4|Sunday 1 September 2019 || 10:25 || Final D |- | 11:01 || Final C |- | 12:18 || Final B |- | style=background:lemonchiffon| 14:27 ||style=background:lemonchiffon| Final A |} All times are Central European Summer Time (UTC+2) ==Results== ===Heats=== The two fastest boats in each heat advanced directly to the quarterfinals. The remaining boats were sent to the repechages. ====Heat 1==== {|class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !Rank !Rower !Country !Time !Notes |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 1 | align="left"|Magdalena Lobnig | SC/D |} ===Semifinals E/F/G=== In each semi, the boats progressed as follows: The two fastest were sent to the E final. Any remaining (bar the slowest) were sent to the F final. The slowest were sent to the G final. ====Semifinal 1==== {|class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !Rank !Rower !Country !Time !Notes |- | 1 | align="left"|Eeva Karppinen | align="left"| | 7:59.15 | FE |- | 2 | align="left"|Viktorija Senkutė | align="left"| | 7:59.52 | FE |- | 3 | align="left"|Anna Markulinova | align="left"| | 8:01.19 | FF |- | 4 | align="left"|Joan Poh | align="left"| | 8:25.73 | FF |- | 5 | align="left"|Akossiwa Ayivon | align="left"| | 8:35.54 | FG |} ====Semifinal 2==== {|class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !Rank !Rower !Country !Time !Notes |- | 1 | align="left"|Tala Abujbara | align="left"| | 8:00.01 | FE |- | 2 | align="left"|Rojjana Raklao | align="left"| | 8:01.73 | FE |- | 3 | align="left"|Jelisaveta Simaceva | align="left"| | 8:04.36 | FF |- | 4 | align="left"|Dareen Mahmoud Mohamed | align="left"| | 8:33.78 | FG |} ====Semifinal 3==== {|class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !Rank !Rower !Country !Time !Notes |- | 1 | align="left"|Kenia Lechuga | align="left"| | 8:01.29 | FE |- | 2 | align="left"|Kim Ye-ji | align="left"| | 8:09.25 | FE |- | 3 | align="left"|Alejandra Alonso | align="left"| | 8:22.86 | FF |- | 4 | align="left"|Sarah Fraincart | align="left"| | 8:30.87 | FG |} ===Semifinals C/D=== The three fastest boats in each semi were sent to the C final.
